actions.committee: Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

official_title: A bill to determine the rights and interests of the Choctaw Nation, the Chickasaw Nation, and the Cherokee Nation in and to the bed of the Arkansas River below the Canadian fork and to the eastern boundary of Oklahoma.

summary.text: Choctaw-Chickasaw-Cherokee Boundary Dispute Act - Grants the consent of the United States to the Choctaw Nation, the Chickasaw Nation, and the Cherokee Nation to bring suit against each other, and against any other persons, or entities, to quiet the beneficial title in and to the bed of the Arkansas River below the Canadian fork and to the eastern boundary of Oklahoma. Provides that any action commended under this Act shall be heard and determined by a three-judge Federal court.

titles.title: A bill to determine the rights and interests of the Choctaw Nation, the Chickasaw Nation, and the Cherokee Nation in and to the bed of the Arkansas River below the Canadian fork and to the eastern boundary of Oklahoma.
